reviews_data.review_text: Busy, Busy, Busy... but that didn't stop the staff from being friendly and efficient! Great coffee!!

Ordered a flat white, and barista told me it came in a 6oz cup rather than the typical 8oz small size. I was okay with that as I know it's two shots of espresso with milk, not meant to be a large drink. But that small 6oz cup was only half full when they gave it to me. You pay extra for non-dairy milk and I feel like I got maybe a splash at best of almond milk. Not worth the $5 I paid for 3oz of coffee.

This place should be called Cafe "Joke-a". I had the unfortunate experience to visit the Cafe on a Tuesday, early afternoon.  I found the staff, inattentive, lackidasical, and  slightly rude.  The attitude was "I could give shxx what you want...".  A simple inquiry about any brewed coffee was scorned.  I didn't have time to wait for a pour-over.  I ordered a hot latte - 2 shots, less than 12 oz of milk.  Purely tasteless and over $6 bucks.  What a waste.  I never intend to return.

MY FAVORITE PLACE!! I take everyone I know here. They have espresso, creamy smoothies, teas, and a pleasant vibe to go with it. Fast service. Great for taking pictures with friends or a day in office. Support small businesses!! Pics to come.
Great coffee, cool deco, and awesome service.
Loved the interior and the unique flavors of coffee and mocha.
Staff is not very friendly, seemed shocked when I came in to order an iced coffee. Coffee was subpar as well. Space is very limited.
Amazing location, very knowledgeable staff, and some of the best coffee ive ever had.
Nice little coffee shop. Clean and friendly staff.
Good coffee Quick Service and a great place to meet and talk
Coffee is good but small

Went in for a coffee, coffee was delicious. I did experience a bit of the staff's unfriendliness, however i went back in to chat with the young man and he asked me what he can do to be better, we had a great chat! So maybe before someone goes to write a bad review, take some time to be thankful that you are blessed enough to pay 6$ for a coffee. Also have some grace for the staff because you have also received many graces throughout your life, we all have bad days or moments.

Love this non-chain coffee shop. Have been enjoying the vibe and their coffee since they first opened. Never had a bad experience!  Great spots to sit inside and outside and visit with friends or catch up on work or Bible Study.  Advice - park in the parking deck to avoid the traffic and parking mess in Waverly.  Suggestion for the establishment - more treat options to enjoy with your beverage selection.

The vibes at Moka are so great. I love the vintage feel of the space. The cinnamon peak latte is to die for. I got that the first time I ever went and it's so good that I've never even tried anything else. I go there JUST for that. It is so great! Would absolutely recommend!!
W spot W employees
Excellent barista
I love this coffee shop! Their vibe is so fun, they have a huge selection of drinks, and they taste great too!
love coming here every time i'm back from college, it's truly a great atmosphere and has the best lattes around!! i miss it when i'm away
Yuck to the coffee and attitude of staff

Wow this place is the most unique coffee shop around.  The level of creativity in blending new flavors is incredible! I enjoyed an Iced Blackberry Coffee Lemonade which has left me thinking about this drink 24/7.  Super chill atmosphere, very clean and most delightful baristas around!!

All of the girls that work here seem like they hate their life and take it out on the customers. I really enjoy my coffee being slammed on the counter and it coming out of the top, asked for napkins and it was the end of the world. god forbid one of these girls wakes up on the right side of the bed one day.  Seems like there are a lot of reviews of the great customer service yet clearly nothing has been done by the owner.
Good Ethiopian coffee. Cashiers very friendly

Went in with my friend for coffees and the girls working there kept looking kinda down upon us..We we're both not feeling comfortable. When I started ordering, one of the girls kept typing smth on her phone while I was standing right in front of her giving her my order. I left tips just because I felt pity, since it looked like they were very displeased with their jobs there. We also both asked for cream in our coffees and it seemed like they put literally one drop of cream in both of our coffees‚Ä¶we did not like those coffees at all! For that taste, we definitely overpaid.

The stuff was very unfriendly and I felt awful there, they told my kids not to play inside despite it was innocent. when I asked for a mug they pointed that I can't go outside and should put dishes away after myself and it was NOT in a nice manner! I did all that but didn't want to stay there at all! coffee was not to my taste too - For coffee houses they'd better ask about the type of beans as not everyone likes sour kind like me. The interior was great but stuff was not nice and coffee and muffins were average. I'm so stressed about WAR in my country - Ukraine - but also can't feel comfortable having coffee!!!
‚ÄúCoffee brewing Company‚Äù without coffee. They literally do not serve coffee which means no refills and you get an Americano instead for $4.50.

Cafe Moka may lack in space with seating but they make up for it with their menu! Love the flavor offerings to level up on an iced latte in the summer or a flat white in fall/winter. Not your basic coffee shop for sure! @ediblejoy IG

Cute coffee shop with lots of coffee and shop themed gifts.  Unfortunately our macchiatos were very very sour tasting and not deep and smooth like we are used to drinking in Italy.  When we brought this up the barista offered to make us another with a darker roast but it was still so sour neither one of us could drink it so we asked for a refund.  They weren't very nice about it and the manager kinda gave me attitude which I felt was extremely unprofessional.  As an aside, we were not offered a choice on the roast or type of coffee prior to ordering.
Very cute decor and yummy iced lattes! A lovely little spot to hang and do some work

Terrible experience today. I come here often and give my loyal service but  today I was extremely disappointed. I ordered a almost 7 dollar matcha  that  I did not like  . I politely asked the barista to add some more oatmilk while she proceeded to look at me like I had 4 heads and poured slowly into my cup.  The drink was off and did not taste good. I asked the  barista who was making the drinks if I could get something else she's simply said you can pay for another drink.  Very disappointed in the service and the awkward stares the the staff gave me while speaking to them. I won't be back.
This place is great. Literally have ZERO reason to sit and wait in the line at Starbucks(which is in the same plaza) because Cafe Moka is quiet, quaint and overall just better. Highly recommend!

My first time and I loved the decor, service and drinks. It had several sitting options and a fun, retro vibe. We tried a Honey Matcha Latte, Chai Tea Latte and a Mexican Spice Latte. Each drink had an awesome aroma and taste yummy! I only wish the teas came in a larger size. I can't wait to go back for a smoothie.
Overpriced decent coffee.

Cafe moka raised the prices on the drinks but yet failed to fill my cup of coffee,  only giving me 3/4 of a cup because I did not want ice. The explanation given to me by the barista was a result of me not getting ice. This is not the first time but it will be the last time I pay $7 for coffee and not get what I paid for from Cafe Moka.  Response to owner's comment First of all if hot large beverages are served in the 16 oz cups then the cold without ice should also be served in the correct size cups. When I asked your barista about the drink she respond stating the cup was not filled because of the ice. You and your employees should inform customers of the cups they are getting are not same when requesting no ice, hot and cold are different. I did not have a foul mouth. Your barista could not explain why but you did in your post. Another issue one of your barista insisted my daughter use her pin when paying for her drinks. I've never had to use it at your store.
Ordered a black coffee, somehow the best option was a small pour for 5.40
My favorite coffee shop in Charlotte! I get their cafe moka almost every week.
I went to have a coffee I asked for it Hot, first it was strong and second when I asked them to put more Milk they put it cold for a Hot coffee.  Make sure they give you good service.

This coffee shop is kind of a gem, great coffee shop vibes in an are of town that is so ‚Äúperfect‚Äù. Not what you'd expect. The seating options look good but are not very comfortable. But the coffee is phenomenal. Looks like they have a partnership with Red Rooster. I wouldn't mind seeing more of these around Charlotte. I worked in here for a few hours and had a few coffees and it went from slow to very busy. They have a code to get into their restroom which seems very unnecessary.
Cute place with a good selection of coffee and if you love tea they actually have a great selection.

Service withe attitude! Got two drinks and milk was off. Returned it to be told that ‚ÄúI just opened the carton‚Äù, took the drinks and in a minute a had two ‚Äúnew‚Äù drinks except it was the same drink. They think you are a monkey and wont notice it. ZERO stars. Even to mention a star in connection to these rookies is a blasphemy!

Hours are misleading! Wanted somewhere to study for a quick couple hours and saw that they were open until 8. I ordered my drink in a mug that I brought- a capuccino with chocolate- or you could call it a mocha with dry milk, I suppose. The barista made it for me, and literally 5 seconds after I sat down, they informed me, as well as the other customers, that they were ‚Äúclosing their indoor seating‚Äù in 5 minutes at 6:00. There goes my evening. At least they could have told me they were closing before I ordered my drink. I ordered it in a regular mug, not a travel one or anything, which I would think is a pretty clear sign I intend to stay. It doesn't even say anywhere on their website or Instagram that their indoor seating closes early. At least make it evident if you're going to do that. I wasted an hour of my evening and 6$ because of misleading hours. And I wouldn't have said anything, but while we're at it, the drink was pretty mediocre. Could barely taste the espresso. I volunteered to pay for a large despite my mug being probably between 10 and 12 ounces. Just tasted like cocoa and too much, too dry milk- and I'm a barista, so I know what a good mocha or cappuccino tastes like. Also, there was no latte art, which definitely isn't expected, but it's another missed opportunity to make my experience more enjoyable. I only bought it because I wanted to hang out, which I was unable to do. I'll just say it didn't make up for the rest of my experience.  Just disappointing. The barista was pleasant, but failed to provide me with the most basic and extremely relevant information. If you're going to have some kind of different indoor seating hours, at least advertise it well- unless the baristas are lying to make people leave early, which is, you know, worse. The customer shouldn't have to go out of their way to discover your secret hours. Probably will never go back.

Wish I would have gotten a picture of the legit slow bar, "pour over". Quite the science, not seen since moving back from PDX. This is actually worth the $5 cup of coffee, no cream needed, just legit labor of love! Hats off, your staff was super kind and patient.

The entire staff present was welcoming and friendly! Immediately, I felt comfortable and happy here! The warm conversation and  absence of masks was refreshing. I appreciate that they allow each person to make their own decision in regards to masking and social distancing. Also the coffee is delicious! I will definitely be returning and bringing people with me!!
My coffee was absolutely delicious and the service was great!
Absolutely amazing vibe. Their coffee is pretty good, but the feel on the inside is like an actual cafe

Different vibe in the evening. First time not going in the AM. All eyes on me, but being in this area it's common. However, never felt or saw that I was being watched at this location whenever I came in the mornings. I'll definitely still come, not after 11AM, though.
I enjoyed my Espresso today and coffee !!! Cozy place.

Wow!! For only been open a few days "unofficially" I can tell that this place is going to be super popular for the people who really care about craft coffee and community in this area of Charlotte. The staff are super friendly and the environment is well crafted for time spent there for any length of time. You can tell that the staff are working hard to serve their community with great service and incredible tasting coffee. I wish China had a coffee shop like this. I guess I will just have to come back and visit when I am stateside.

This is THE BEST local coffee shop I have ever been too! I literally drive to Charlotte just for a Peanut Butter Moka Frozen Latte. Each drink is crafted perfectly and NOT rushed or burnt like Starbucks. I have never been disappointed with anything I have tried here and I've been supporting this local business for years. The owner creates seasonal drinks that are AMAZING! I promise, it is totally worth it!
Absolutely pathetic service and a very arrogant staff,blue berry muffin had green fungus on it,they did not replace it nor refunded the money,just not worth visiting.

I came here with my husband on a Sunday afternoon. The shop itself is very cute. What I did notice right away was an employee sitting down on the counter while on his phone (behind the register). He didn't even look up to greet us. I'm not sure if he was on his break or not, but if he was, I don't think it's appropriate to sit with dirty pants on a counter where food and drinks are being served. Anyway. My husband ordered a latte and said it was mediocre - Starbucks is better. I'm not a coffee person but my husband said he wouldn't recommend the place for the coffee. It was our first and last time going there.

From the modern neighborhood coffee shop vibe, to the friendly baristas and most importantly to a really good cup of coffee - Cafe Moka checks all the boxes for me. It's always fun to sit inside and take in all the nostalgia |  nods to the 70's.

Cafe moka is my absolute favorite coffee shop!  This is my go-to coffee spot, and they never disappoint. Their coffee is the best, very good quality! Baristas are very nice and friendly. Highly recommend!
Love Cake Mika! Best coffee in town!

Coffee is great and I'd love to choose this place over Starbucks, but service is slow! Would be great to have more than 1 person making drinks because I waited 20 minutes for an iced latte. Sending this because I want management to know that this a blocker for busy people... and is why I continue to run to Starbucks instead. Can also be hard to find parking.
First time here and the coffee was incredible. Great atmosphere, nice baristas and I will definitely be back!
Great coffee. Cozy space.

Went here on a Saturday evening for 2 expressos  and sadly to say they were horrible. Had to throw them out. Inexperienced batista. More like a playground for them. Its sad, it could be so much better! Never again, I was embarrassed to bring my guest there.

Horrible experience. cappuccino had espresso shots and weak foam and no milk. When asked for a little bit off milk she said can not give you anymore. She said if I give you more milk then Ill have to give every one more.  I never had such strong cappuccino in my life, if I wanted just espresso shot I would have ordered it.
Our favorite coffee stop when in Charlotte.  Unique vibe and great coffee!  Baristas are always friendly!

I'm new to the area and had this shop recommended by a friend. The staff is friendly and the shop is locally owned and the owner has clearly though-out out ever detail of the atmosphere and the menu. I don't go anywhere but here when I need a pick me up from their large selection of coffee, tea, and smoothie selection. I would give 10 stars if I could.

Every time I am here I have a great experience. The coffee is the best in town and the atmosphere is awesome. There is ample seating inside and out now that the COVID restriction have been lifted in Charlotte and the prices are cheaper then starbucks and other shops in the city. If you are in south Charlotte this is a must visit.
I go here all the time. Coffee is amazing, atmosphere is amazing. But like compared to other places customer service seems kinda bland ‚Ä¶.
Amazing service, great coffee and flavored drinks, would definitely recommend! Baristas were so helpful and nice. Absolutely coming back in the future :)
Really good place. When Im feeling down, this is my go to pick me up. I have tried all of their indulgent lattes and I cannot pick a favorite. Must try !!
I LOVE caf√© moka!!! the baristas are great and it has a great atmosphere, fav drink is aztec moka
Great experience! Rylie the barista with pink hair was super helpful with navigating the menu and gave great service. Will come back again for sure! Also the ambiance is very welcoming and relaxing.
pink haired barista was very friendly and made my iced vanilla oat milk latte deliciously! she was amazing! PS- the banana bread is top tier!

Service is key for my experience. Twice I have been to this place and I have not been impressed by the customer service. Also, find it extremely annoying to have a set of rules of dos and don't's set on each table. As for the coffee,  it's not bad but ain't the best.

Terrible customer service, 2 bad experiences unrelated to coffee:  Walked in one morning, was ignored by the lady at the counter.  Tried again another morning. The guy saw me and walked away into the back room, ignoring me.  Not sure if this was racially motivated or because I was wearing a mask, but I warn everyone I know not to come here. 1 star is generous.

June 2021  Small place. So far,  no variety in the drinks.  The only sugar-free drink available is iced plain coffee. No sugar-free flavors are available. (Thank you for thinking about diabetic people or with other conditions).  It's overpriced for the taste of the coffee.  I don't understand what people find here.  Outside was more than 90 degrees and you have 3 little tables for 2. A place with two chairs and a small couch, And a little bar beside the window.  Bathrooms are locked. So you need to ask for a code from any employee. And the place was dirty and packed.  My friend paid $12,99 for a small plain black coffee and a muffin. I didn't know if I was in NY or Charlotte lol.  Not worthy for me and never come back. There are small much better family businesses than this chain, that have more merchandise to sell instead of coffee.

If I could give this place more stars, I would! Their coffee is one of the best, if not the best, places in Charlotte to grab a cup. Also, their winter tea latte are AMAZING! üëè I've never been disappointed with how my drink came out. Constantly brewed to perfection, whatever I get! I'm always recommending this place to anyone and everyone and will continue to do so. You cant go wrong here! ü§ó

Rude staff, service subpar and coffee almost never good. Smoothies are very run down.  3 stars are for them not enforcing masking and social distancing and letting people choose for themselves. Kudos to that.

The staff behind the counter had an unfriendly, rude attitude. She rushed me to order (the place wasn't busy then) and didn't offer to explain some of the different coffees on the menu when I clearly needed some help - overall poor customer service. The experience left a bad taste. The coffee was average, made without care and served at room temperature.  No social distancing as well. Used to be a nice friendly place. Not anymore.

Inconsistent coffee preparation every single time, in some instances completely undrinkable. Ordered a cappuccino this week and literally poured it out after taking a sip outside. Have been here 3-4 times and likely won't return. Staff attitude, as well as a complete lack of social distancing and non-compliance with mask laws are also abhorrent.
Nice place to have coffe and meet with friends
The best coffee shop in the area. The coffee is made the right way, they go to great lengths to ensure their customers get the best possible coffee. Very friendly staff. Highly recommended!
The lattes are great! My husband loves the mocha. ‚ù§
Only come here because it's the only cafe around  Poor service, limited milk options and nothing sugar free. Employees always have negative attitudes and not welcoming.
Great service,  the coffee quality surpasses any coffee chain. There is a constant flow of all kinds of people who come for their treat. Will definitely be back.

Cafe Moka is a one-of-a-kind coffee shop that deserves two thumbs up. The staff is incredibly friendly and sweet, and the menu is just diverse enough to suit everyone! They serve great coffee and provide a truly fun and special environment for their guests. If anyone is thinking about stopping here to grab a coffee or some very fun merch, do it!! :)

I love this place. The drinks are so tasty and the atmosphere is great. My favorite is the Peanut butter moka frozen latte but I can say they have something for everyone. My wife is not a big coffee drinker but every time we go she finds something new to like. The staff is very friendly and knowledgeable with great recommendations if you can't decide.
one of the best coffee places in charlotte. iced vanilla oatmilk latte cannot be beat. highly recommend stopping by for some coffee!

I've been wanting to try this place for a couple of weeks and finally stepped in. It's a little shop, but it was very comfortable and it looked pretty popular. I appreciate that mask wearing and social distancing is left up to individuals, because adult customers and shop owners should be free to make up their own minds on that.  I normally go for black coffee or americano, but the mokato caught my eye. It was amazing! Subtly sweet (I don't like overly sweet drinks) and a pleasant combination of flavors. I will be back!
Thank you for staying open! Great coffee in awesome location!

Atmosphere and coffee are both top notch!  We make it a point to stop here every time we come thru Charlotte as the cafe mocha with oat milk cannot be beat - Stop in to enjoy the best coffee around, casual ambiance, bagged coffee and cool merchandise - Definitely worth the stop!
BEST COFFEE BEST ENVIORNMENT

Really hot man working at the counter, very friendly smile as well. I believe his name is Landon Basham he's just such a people person all the customers come to see him. Same thing for a man named Addison that works there. I always enjoy the days I come by and chatter with the friendly local staff.

This place has okay coffee but the lady at the front (either the manager or the owner) is rude every single time I go there. EVERYONE was wearing their mask BELOW their nose; even the people making the coffee.  There is also a sign on the door that says people on the staff have a 'medical condition' that prevents them from wearing masks (interesting as it's been proven that masks don't hinder a person's oxygen or carbon dioxide levels, even people lung disease and asthma) but whatever. This aside:  As our country sets daily death toll records and health care professionals suffer with overcrowding ICUs, I REFUSE to support businesses that can't do the absolute minimum to protect its customers. Wear. A. Mask.
Great selection of coffee, excellent staff/customer service

Okay okay... A lot could be said about the shop itself. The baristas are helpful, it's a warm environment and a great place to relax at. Now about the coffee. This is where it's at. I'm a really big fan of a traditional mexican mocha and have traveled the country trying them at all the local shops I've been to. Cafe Moka sticks out and hands down has the best I've ever had. Thanks guys! I'll be back!

I absolutely adore Cafe Moka.  Been coming here since it has opened.  Great people, vibes, and coffee.  The owner is such a gem.  I am so glad that they made it through the pandemic/shutdown and have continued to provide a great atmosphere and quality coffee / products.  It is my go-to coffee place, and I'm very fortunate (as a resident in Waverly) to have a beautiful hole-in-the-wall coffee shop to spend quality time in.  If you haven't been here, try any of their frozen drinks!!  So good... My staples are also the iced lavender latte (with oat milk), and the blackberry coffee lemonade during the summer.  Absolutely TO DIE FOR!!  Thank you Moka crew for all you guys are to this community!
The frozen lattes here are so good! The shop is pretty cool and has a very trendy feel inside. I've yet to be disappointed
Excellent service and didn't harass me for a mask. To me the creme taste a little weird when I make a simple coffee, but my friends love it.

Went today for a autumn tea latte. The girl working the register (dark hair/ dark complexion) had such an attitude. Even my friend agreed that was with me when we ordered. She was not aware of the latte specials without having to read it off the screen and every question I had about the menu she acted clearly annoyed I was asking questions. I would really consider having someone that is better at customer service and being friendly to people work your register. It was a great latte! But the customer service doesn't make me want to return.
Perfectly made handcrafted coffees.
The frozen lattes are fantastic!
Best coffee shop in South Charlotte

Tried coffee latte, it was just ok.  No greeting when customer enters the shop. Not listening properly but always talking to his boy friend most of the time instead of listening what customer needs. Please change the girls working over there otherwise it may lead to loss.

I love this place and their coffee, but today on my visit the person making the coffees was not wearing a mask. I found this a but concerning. However, most of my experiences here have been good and most of their staff is very attentive and sweet. Today was the exception.
It was a great experience

Do not come here if taking social distancing seriously. I emailed about bringing my child who is immunocompromised to see if staff was taking precautions. (We used to love coming here and playing outside!). I did not receive a response. I popped in and staff was not wearing masks. The coffee is great, but I feel bad as I really wanted to support a local biz during these hard times.

super cute coffee shop, the staff is so nice and the decor is absolutely beautiful. drinks are great, smoothies 10/10, coffee 10/10. beans are well roasted and i love the prices, under $5 for a good coffee or smoothie!

The coffee and teas are good but I much prefer Starbucks. Dont think I will be going back because only one of the employees were wearing a mask and none of the customers inside at the table had on masks.
Best iced caramel latte I've had recently. Coffees and hot lattes are also rich and smooth with a sweet aftertaste. Place has a good selection of flavors as well. Never disappointed when I go.
This a great place!  The place is so clean and the staff is very friendly!  Support your local businesses!

Best matcha latte I've ever had (and I've had quite a few from small local coffee shops and chain coffee shops)! The Honey Matcha Latte was smooth, creamy, perfectly sweet, and no bitter aftertaste. Can't wait to go back!

Was excited to try this place but couldn't place an order. Despite being in the middle of a global pandemic, none of the workers were wearing any masks or gloves. I would rather have my espresso without deadly virus.

Awesome Cafe Moka Frozen Latte. The customer service was blah. I didn't feel welcomed in and once my drink was ready they called drink name out and slid it across counter. No connection afterwards like thank you or a smile etc. Thank You goes a long way just food for thought.....
Great local coffee shop with hip decor and super cool pour over coffee. Go here instead of Starbucks!
the girl named lexie is really nice! amazing customer service and amazing coffee
they are very nice and very sweet! idk about all your reviews but mine was terrific.. 10/10 would do again
Great service..i had some kenya berry, slow brew! Man it was yummy
Not open Sunday so they need to change their listing here. Multiple people have shown up and been disappointed.
Fair prices and good quality
If you like the taste of paper filters, this is the place for you. Although it might be cheaper to just chew on some filters. I've tried several times, I know the beans are good, the Brew is not.

Cafe Moka has absolutely amazing coffee and everything is really well prices! So many places charge so much for a cup of coffee, but Cafe Moka is very fair. I got an amazing espresso drink and it was 10 times better than anything you can get at any coffee chain
Love it get a fun latte of sorts. Cute atmosphere so quirky I'm a big fan
I love environment, and craft coffee. üôèüèº
Great local coffee comfortable atmosphere.

This place reminds me of a coffeehouse in San Francisco. You can tell these guys are serious about their coffee. I got an Americano with a double shot. It was full bodied with great flavor. Definitely a cool hang out. I love the interior. My only suggestion would be to turn the music up a little bit. It was very quiet the afternoon I was there and you could almost hear conversations from across the room.

The coffee is very good. I like how they have the drinks arranged on the menu board - makes it easy to find what you want. The staff is always kind and helpful. I love the atmosphere - it's homey and unique, much better than the cookie-cutter chains.  This cafe is a great place to sit and chat with a friend or read a book or get some work done.

Good coffee, everything else is just wrong. Customers need to purchase before being able to use the bathroom. Bathroom doors are equipped with a digital lock, not what you would expect at such upscale location. Multiple signs for where to place the dirty dishes. Appearance of coziness, but totally uncomfortable atmosphere, noice, seating... not inviting for the remote worker/telecommuter. What a disappointment!
Great coffee bar, great location
Designed to appeal directly to the 3 authentic hipsters living south of 51, but everyone else will appreciate feeling trendy and drinking fancy coffee too.
It's good mmmmmmm they also have hex coffee which rules
Amazing coffee shop. Wonderful people and amazing vibes. The coffee is stellar. Best coffee in clt...
Nice cafe.  Casual and cozy.  The coffee is very good.  We love to sit in the cafe, have a coffee and look outside at kids playing and people hanging out in Waverly.

My husband and I have visited this coffee shop several times now. I really enjoy their coffee, and even like their over the top creative seasonal drinks (so fun!). My husband, on the other hand, is not a fan of the taste of their coffee. It's too bitter tasting for his preference. Today I ordered a basic iced coffee. Tastes like other places' nitro or cold brew. I loved it!
If you are looking for the Best coffe in town and great ambient and enjoy some great conversation with somebody ?? Then this is the place

Beware, False advertisement! This place advertises  Cuban ( Latin) style coffee. They even use Latin names for the coffees on there menu board. I use an actual moka pot at home because my husband is Panamanian.  A moka pot makes strong Cuban or Italian espresso on the stovetop. The coffee at Moka Cafe is 100% americano. For those that do not understand the word Americano... think of it as Maxwell House or Folgers coffee from the grocery store.  It tastes thin and dirty. Save your money.
Super cute place! Great place to sit and work or study

Let me open by saying that the quality of the drinks I ordered were fantastic. Everything we got were well-made and tasted great. They had a great selection of coffees, the vibe of the shop was awesome, there was good seating, and it was clean and well kept. The reason I can't give a full five stars is because the baristas were extremely rude. They looked thoroughly displeased to be serving us and everyone else who walked in, and were VERY short and dismissive in their interactions; not just with us but with everyone who came in after us, too. Their demeanor only changed when someone they knew came in; otherwise they honestly just seemed annoyed that any of us were there. The other minor issue we had was that the WiFi was extremely slow and kept cutting out, which made working there pretty difficult.
Good coffee in a great area
Best Dark Chocolate salted Carmel hot chocolate!
The staff is friendly. The interior is very clean. Very small selection of baked goods buy the coffee is super delicious. Outdoor seating is available.

I got a sweetened blackberry and raspberry black tea and it was delicious!!! I got a small and I drank it all within like 10 minutes. My sisters coffee was amazing also! Definitely recommend this place! ;)

As a college age, self employed coffee lover i'm always looking for new coffee shops to spend endless hours huddled in a corner. The moment I heard Moka was opening I was so excited and have loved it ever since! With the calm atmosphere, open environment and even better coffee (I have yet to try everything) I cant help but invite new friends and spend every chance I get at Cafe Moka. You definitely need to come!
Some workers have a bad attitude towards customers.

Me and my husband has tried three times to go to this coffee shop and they were never open!! Google always says they are open and then we would drive there and found they are not! And they don't pick up their phones either! If google's hour is wrong and you don't pick up your phone, how can your customers know when you are open, if ever?? We gave up trying because it didn't worth our time!
Loved the decoration of the place,  Great Barista, delicious coffee and muffins.

This place has all of your coffee needs! Whether you are in the mood for an espresso based drink or an incredible cup of well made coffee they always have a few different varieties from different origins and roasters. Taste them all!
Great coffee....so much better than a Starbucks

Nice local coffee shop feel, great place to chill or hop on the wifi for a while. After a couple visits the staff knew me and my order and that feels nice. The coffee is great, at least for someone like me who doesn't know much about coffee. They have oat milk which makes for a better vegan latte than almond  milk. The common crowd gives off a pretty strong youth group vibe ü§∑
My favorite coffee place

Exceptional coffee! Large variety of coffee drinks! Baristas who know their craft!  And a huge variety of *syrups* for us outcasts who like to experiment with "ruining" our lattes and frozen coffees with added flavors, AND they actually *list* all of them so you can actually choose what you'd like BEFORE ordering! üìÑüòØ  They also have a great selection of teas and smoothies along with amazing, fresh looking pastries (my mom loved the pastry she got), but unfortunately, every time I've gone, I've both had no appetite and was craving their coffee. So I've never tried anything else, but I genuinely plan to. Eventually. üòÖ  There's a Sta***cks in the same shopping centre, and if you're still going there after Moka opened, you're crazy... For basically the same pricing, you could be getting actually delicious coffee from people who know how to brew coffee. Instead you waste your money and treat time on the fact that Sta***cks has a drive-thru?! I understand, sometimes you're on the way to work. But so are the 10 other people in line at that drive-thru every morning... It's really not that difficult to park in one of the abundant spaces at Waverly near Moka, and get out of your car for the amount of time you'd have waited in the drive-thru line, if you're gonna get coffee.  And when you're not in a rush? There's no excuse for sub-par coffee. I used to go to Sta***cks before Moka opened, but then, there were no good, independent coffee shops around locally with superior product.  Now there is.
Great coffee, mocha's etc. easy access. Love it every time  in town.
Awesome little shop with amazing coffee. Would highly recommend a fresh pour over here if you love coffee.

Pretty nice and very cozy little coffee shop. Wish they made to go drinks by name, that would help with drink confusion and not knowing who's drink is who's. I got the carmel iced latte, it was alright... It was way too sweet and not enough coffee flavor for my preference. I would come back and try the drip brews.
Nice cozy place, love the ambience. Freshly brewed coffee for every order.
Freakin' good coffee! And the brownie was tasty too. Cool place and atmosphere and did I mention that the coffee was good too?

Best pourover coffee in Charlotte. Call me crazy but I think these guys brew a better cup than any of the famous coffee shops I hit in NYC or San Francisco. The coffee is also very consistent so I never have to worry about a bad cup. Nice that they keep 4 different beans in stock to allow you to experiment. If there was anything to dock this place on it would be the pastries...a bit on the dry side.
Tried it with the family and absolutely LOVED it.  Serious coffee owners, great atmosphere, and great prices.  Bringing local feel and excellent coffee - kudos to the owners for hitting the mark!
Cute coffee shop with a great menu. Lots of alternative milk options which we loved.
Been there once that was enough... Train your people

Unfortunately, for my bank account, I come here almost every day! Fortunately, for my tummy and I...this place makes us very happy! This is the best coffee around and I am so glad that it opened. The staff is very friendly too. I highly recommend :-)

Really great place. Nice ambiance, and top notch tasting drinks. I will say it's without a doubt the most expensive coffee shop I've ever been to, but I think that the quality of the drinks makes up for it.
Great staff, great coffee, and great atmosphere.

Best coffee around! You can't get any better than this. Very good variety of coffee and espresso, and flavors are always on point! Must have been here about 50 times already. Definitely my to go spot for coffee. Starbucks who? Not worth paying for cheap coffee full of milk and sugar when you got a great place like this. Oh and the sea salt hazelnut spiced hot cocoa is crack!
Coffee is okay. The service is terrible. They are not friendly and they charge you for a water cup. Not coming back.
Excellent coffee experience!

A very nice, little boutique coffee shop with lots of personality. I can certainly see this as a place to come for a coffee beverage after having dinner in one of the many restaurants close by. The employee I interacted with while placing my order was friendly, although perhaps a little uninformed about what was sold. (When I was told that there were two coffee bean choices available, I asked if they were different roasts and was told that they were both "brown".) However, I feel like the kinks with service will be worked out. Beverage prices are comparable to national chains, but retail item prices are pretty high.
Awesome place! Killer staff! I'm now a regular for sure! üç¥
Awesome coffee shop! Delicious coffee pourovers and tasty espresso drinks. Try their pastries! Loved the Jazz that was playing when I came in... this is how coffee shops should be! üòÉüëå
Great prices! Great service! Friendly staff and fun drink ideas! I got the peach rose tea and it was amazing! And the environment was cool! Highly recommend!

Pricey latte- 20%+ higher than other coffee shops around southern charlotte. Ordered a hot latte, got a iced latte. I dont care that much about it, except if i'm paying a ridiculous price for a latte it better be perfect.  No comfortable seats. Pews look cool, but they're not the most comfortable to sit in.  Good ambiance overall.  Music choice was terrible- luckily wasn't very loud, but i'm not looking to listen to club music while reading a book and drinking coffee.
The Espresso was pretty disappointing. The caramel frozen latte is basically a mcdonalds mcfrappe. There are much better coffee places in Charlotte. Has a cool inside though, along with good service
GREAT coffee and perfect location! You can let your kids play in the area in front while you grab coffee! The coffee is very fresh and tastes wonderful.
Exceptionally great service and amazing coffee!!

Great ambience but coffee isn't that great The baristas didn't provide us the experience of drinking craft coffee - it wasn't hot when we asked for extra hot, no art, and the coffee was lacking the right flavors I encourage them to go visit not just coffee and see their simple coffee experience from the baristas who are passionate about every cup of coffee they craft and serve for you Good luck because this is meant to be constructive criticism only I know that based on your Facebook posts the coffee is much better than what we had experience
What a great vibe plus some of the best coffee II've had . Cafe au lait was perfect taste and temperaturetemperature .  Great location in waverly , I will be back often .
Great new place in the neighborhood. Good vibe and good coffee. They could work on their customer interface. No smiles. Not super friendly.
They know coffee!  They have a great variety of options too. My kids love it as well.  Excited for Charlotte to have this non chain location at Waverly to enjoy.   Try the teas and tea lattes too.
First cup of coffee in my life that needed no additive! Absolutely fabulous!
